title: Decanter And Stopper, ca. 1820
inscribed: One side engraved: "The Bushmill Old Distillery, Co. Antrim, Ireland"; a picture of the distillery marked "pure malt"
provenance: W.G.T. Burne, London; 1965: Walter Phelps Warren; 1986: bequested to Museum
description: Square-sided body with chamfered corners cut with fine horizontal blazes, shoulder cut with wide flutes, wide lip; one side engraved with "The Bushmill Old Distillery, Co. Antrim, Ireland, " and a picture of the distillery marked "pure malt" surrounded by shamrocks; bottom cut with star; stopper mushroom-shaped with hexagonal faceting.

tombstone.epitaph:
Decanter And Stopper, ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Glass. Bequest of Walter Phelps Warren. 1986-61-167-a,b.
